cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 20 mi north of Great Inagua Island
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest for another day, then turning northwest toward the Florida Keys and peninsula before curving inland across Georgia/Alabama

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge watch north of Jupiter Inlet FL to Sebastian Inlet and north of Bonita Beach FL to Venice
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and storm-surge warnings encircle most of the Florida peninsula and Keys; no Mississippi coast warnings
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Bahamas, Cuba north coast, entire Florida peninsula, then inland Georgia and eastern Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Only a very small (≤4%) chance of tropical-storm-force gusts late Monday–Tuesday; otherwise breezy conditions
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Mississippi coast from Irma
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could produce 1–2 inches of rain early next week
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increased surf and rip currents along the Mississippi barrier islands
